body: Remove the underscore
It was supposed to be a dash.
Why are you commenting out this line as opposed to removing it?
I'm assuming you choose 8 as the maximum length based on the building codes I entered, right?
Why is the dash that separates the two sections optional? Is `1130AM0200PM` a valid time?
Yes, otherwise it picks up the next class as the name of the building
I didn't see the "?" outside of the group. Sorry.
Some left over commenting, my bad.
Why `===`? Can you be sure that all JavaScript interpreters see the empty string as the same object globally?
CourseParser.js assigns "" to quarter if the regex for finding the quarter fails. We can be pretty sure that they will both be strings.
But `===` tests for absolute equality. If you had two empty strings that occupied different locations in memory, then `quarter === ""` would be `false`.

It doesn't check for absolute equality. == checks for equality between any two types and === checks for equality for specifically the same type. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7998948/10925921/3c6a5a94-8247-11e5-84fd-a35833a332ed.png)
I'm not sure why the diff shows this area as all deleted and replaced. I checked the website on my machine and all the regular expressions and Javascript seemed to work fine.
Why did you make each part of the time optional? This means that `-1200PM`, `0100PM-` and `-` are valid hours.

@ammongit 
It's a fix for issue #75 

A course like:

`NO TIMES`
`ENGR-092 -001    SN    1.00    TBA -`

Will get picked up, but it's dealt with later on in the program and displayed as an error.
The new regex matches `-` in `TBA` [like this](https://github.com/BradleyCai/ucr-schedule-visualizer/blob/issue-76/etc/test_all_errors.txt#L12). Nice.
Why do you no longer check the value of `quarter`?

Add parentheses for clarity:

``` js
this.bldg = ((bldg === "" || bldg === undefined) ? "TBA" : bldg);
```

It was easier just to leave it blank for checking if it's empty later on. Since the quarter never really gets shown to the user (at least not yet) and since I check if the quarter is empty often, i decided to just leave it blank if none was provided.
The magic numbers do not match the comment.
I don't think this information should be public knowledge. You might need to void this token and make a new one.
Is this file copied from somewhere or original? If it's partially or wholly copied, we'll need to know what it's licensed under before we can use it.

body: Good catch.
`normalize.css` version 3.02 is already in the repos under `css/normalize.css`. We'll work together to see what we can do to merge the new dependencies in.

diff_hunk:
@@ -72,7 +71,31 @@

We also collect statistics about who visits our page. The Akari Link Shortener records the clicks for our shortened link. The click count can be found here. Also, GitHub collects statistics about our general traffic and that can be found here. -

If we ever change this privacy policy we will announce it on the alert section on the main page.
(Last updated: May 2, 2016)

+

Google Calendar integration requires an internet connection + in order to send your schedule to Google so that the courses may + be added to your calendar as events. For this, Google requires + app developers to register for an API key with them and users to + authorize the app that corresponds to that API key in order to + grant privileges to modify the user's calendar. The API key for + this app is registered to + Joel Gomez and is only authorized for requests from specific + domains. + +

If you'd like to get your own API key so that you may run + this application on your own server, instructions are available + + here. Simply replace the key in the resources/api.json [file] + (resources/api.json) with your own, make sure the domain for + your project is registered to your key, and you're set. + +

This app will also make a separate API request to + https://ucr-term-dates.appspot.com in order to get the start and + end times for every quarter so that the dates for the Google Calendar + events are reflective of the quarter's first and last day of + instruction for your convenience. This API is also open source + and the project can be found here. + +

If we ever change this privacy policy we will announce it on the alert section on the main page.
(Last updated: September 27, 2016)
body: Good idea to update the privacy policy. It's getting a bit long, so we should restructure it.
